rooms.Name: The Mountain Village of Shamata
rooms.Description:
This is the north entrance to the village cursed with a plague. A road
lies to the north, which you are truly grateful to see. Where it will
take you, you don't know, but you are sure it will be better than the 
misery lived by so many in this village. It stands to reason that you
would much rather deal with any fate other than a deadly disease.

rooms.Name: Shamata's Central Square
rooms.Description:
This square used to be the site of a merry festival long ago. The proud
people of this town used to celebrate the harvests of herbs and berries
that grew so abundantly in these mountains. But that is now a long distant
memory. The ghosts of those who lived happily in this village so long
ago flood your thoughts. You can almost see the revelry of people dancing
around the town well that stands here unkempt.

rooms.Name: A Foodstuffs Stand
rooms.Description:
As you approach the stand you see a small lady behind the counter. There
are small fires burning with pots hanging above them. A wonderful odor
eminates from the pots. Sacks of rice and flour are piled around the side
of the stand. Fruits and vegetables have been placed on the counter for
sale, although they look too old to eat.

rooms.Name: Jandor's Shop
rooms.Description:
You have entered the shop of Jandor Cullen, the most unorganized person
in the village. Jandor is a handyman around the village, for he never
was smart enough to learn a trade. His tools lie about the small building
scattered, and usually, he can be found sleeping on his desk.

rooms.Name: The Village Stables
rooms.Description:
Here is a small stable used by the entire village for thier beasts of
burden and thier riding animals. There are seven stalls on both sides
from where you stand in this horrid smelling structure. The baying of
mules and the snorts of oxen fill your ears.

rooms.Name: The Dairyman's Shop
rooms.Description:
As you enter, your nose is filled with the strong smell of many varieties
of cheeses. You see a short, stocky fellow sealing cheese in wax at a table
toward the back. Rows of large milk cantainers line the walls. This 
looks quiant enough...

rooms.Name: The Antique Shop
rooms.Description:
This shop has been closed for quite some time. You believe that it must
have failed soon after it was opened. This is a small village and there
is little demand for such luxuries. There are many beautiful things left
here unkempt...

rooms.Name: A Charred Building
rooms.Description:
You have entered a charred, smoldering building. Smoke rolls impatiently
from cracks in the burned wood and cloth. It seems that no less than a
day ago this was a shop of some kind. You see burned barrels and stores
lying aroung the room, thier contents unrecognizable. The smoke begins
to choke you and your eyes begin to burn.

rooms.Name: The Home of a Healer
rooms.Description:
You have entered the home of Taelok Jaalon. For many years he has cured the
sick, healed the injured, and eased the pain of suffering. His learning
came from his father, who before him learned from his father. The Jaalon
family saw most of the village inhabitants born in this very house.
Now, he lies upon his bed dying, with a wealth of knowledge that cannot
save him, and that will perish forever with him. You see numerous books
on the wall. Flasks of liquids stand covered in dust from days of unuse.
You see a fireplace on the wall, and Jaalon lying in his bed.

ExtraDescs.Description:
There are sprigs of rosemary, jasmine, lilac, and dill lying in seperate
piles. The other herbs are crushed together in a small stone bowl. They
give off quite an aroma.

In the fireplace there is a pot. It seems he was cooking something. The fire
is smoldering now, for it hasn't been stoked for a long time.
In the pot seems to be a potion of some sort... maybe a first-try cure..

You open the book to a page where you find the following passage...

     "The trade of such goods as stated above shall be items
      of free trade between the said parties. Should this
      agreement be violated, punishment will ensue as to
      be devastating to Shamata. Through this agreement, both
      parties will progress and prosper. The items the Shamata
      will provide will be used in magical research, in which
      we reserve the rights not to disclose to Shamata at any
      point in time.
      Other items that Shamata will provide for our services are
      as follows...

      Necrum Root, Bresit Vine, Zlis Leaf, Perat Buds, and Dark Root.

      As to the Emerald Queen's services, you or noone else will see
      the physical presence of it here. The village will be protected
      from all manner of life forms with the intent of harm to the
      Village of Shamata. As mentioned above, a break in this

You find the following passage...

 SUMMARY

     " The Queen will provide Shamata with protection from
       all harm as long as the village complies with this 
       agreement. Her presence will neither be seen nor
       heard, but you will see it's effects. If the 
       agreement is breached for any reason, intentional or
       unforseen, punishment will befall Shamata. All
       inhabitants will be affected.

       Items that must be sent immediately....

       Dark Root, Martic Vine, Zlis Leaf, Ghem Root

You open the book to the following passage....

      "Elvandar is the legendary city in the trees. The
       Queen of the Elhedel, Algaranna, is said to reside
       upon her throne there. Great elven weapons are said
       to be produced there with the greastest of powers,
       and made by the most skilled of hands. The city is 
       said to glow with colored auras eminating from the 
       trees, and the sound of work are as music."

rooms.Name: A Corpse-Filled, Abandoned House
rooms.Description:
As you walk into this room, the stench of rotting flesh hits you
square across the face. It is quite dark in here. As your eyes adjust to
the dim light, you begin to notice details. You see the outlines of
broken furniture, wasting away in a long since dead dwelling. You hear
the sounds of flies buzzing about the room, and something scuffling
across the floor. You see something piled agaist the far wall.

ExtraDescs.Description:
Across the room the corpses are pile against the wall. There must be
twenty dead people lying there. Rats and flies cover them in a living,
crawling, pestulent sheet. Their faces are decayed beyond recognition.
God, some of them are children...

rooms.Name: In the Village of Shamata
rooms.Description:
Plagued, huh? Looks normal enough, poeple and animals everywhere...
It doesn't matter that they are lying on the ground... maybe they are
just tired. Yeah, that's it. Tired. You smell a hint of rotten flesh
an smoke to the north. Heh, this could be cool.

rooms.Name: Before the Garrison
rooms.Description:
You are standing before a medium sized Garrison. It looks as though it
could withstand a fairly sizable attack as it has been constructed from
solid rock. You notice that a moat surrounds the entire Garrison and
wooden spikes have been placed along the outside edge of the moat. 
You get the strange feeling that you are being watched...

Exits.Description: A drawbridge is pulled up for protection.

rooms.Name: A Common Villager's Home
rooms.Description:
You see the usual, a small hearth, a table, wooden bowls. You see a bag full
of smelly herbs. In the corner are two beds, small, yet comfortable. These
people weren't rich, but they were content.

rooms.Name: On the Road through Shamata
rooms.Description:
You can feel the despair in the atmosphere as you wander about the town.
You have never seen such misery in the eyes of small children, for
thier loved ones have left them without hope. Is there anything you can 
do to save this once-beautiful mountain city? It seems hopeless.

rooms.Name: On the Road through Shamata
rooms.Description:
You begin to wonder if you haven't made a mistake coming to this town.
From the looks of things, you may never forget this place, and you
really don't want to remember it. To the east is an antique shop, 
maybe you can find some answers there, who knows, there may be something
of use there also. A sign hangs on the fallen over door.

rooms.Name: A Common Villager's Home
rooms.Description:
You see the usual, a small hearth, a table, wooden bowls. You see a bag full
of smelly herbs. In the corner are two beds, small, yet comfortable. These
people weren't rich, but they were content.

rooms.Name: A Common Villager's Home
rooms.Description:
You see the usual, a small hearth, a table, wooden bowls. You see a bag full
of smelly herbs. In the corner are two beds, small, yet comfortable. These
people weren't rich, but they were content.

rooms.Name: The Street Leading to the Kingdom Garrison
rooms.Description:
This path has been well travelled. The Kingdom soldiers march through here
every day to perform thier duties. The garrison being so close to the
Vale of Dreams, a disupted border between the Kingdom and Kesh, it sees
it's share of action. It has been peaceful here, despite the plague,
due to the negotiations between the Kingdom and Kesh.

rooms.Name: On a Street Surrounded by Homes
rooms.Description:
This was once a playground for young children, the common square between homes.
Now the children are sick and lonely, horrified by the death surrounding them.
Many have become orphans and will soon die from starvation, if the inevitable
doesn't happen first. You are surrounded by homes.

rooms.Name: A Street in Shamata
rooms.Description:
The celebrations used to continue throughout these streets. Now, only ghosts
from the past celebrate here, in the hearts and minds of the few that are
left. Noone could have foretold the horror that has visited this small
mountain village. To the north the stench of smoke fills the air.

rooms.Name: On a Street in Shamata
rooms.Description:
You now stand on the east side street in Shamata. Things look pretty bleak 
for the people in this village. To the north is a vegetable stand. You 
wonder how good the produce can be with things the way they are here.
You can see homes futher to the east.

rooms.Name: On a Street Surrounded by Homes
rooms.Description:
This is the easternmost part of the village. You are surrounded by homes of
the people of this tragedy. Where there should be children playing, there
are none. Where there should be people working, there are none. Where there
should be peace and comfort, neither reside....

rooms.Name: The Head of the Village Council's Home
rooms.Description:
This home is not much larger than the rest. It seems that everyone was
pretty much equal here. You see the same here as the other homes, with the
exception of an extra bed, and a book on the table.

ExtraDescs.Description:
You open the book to the last written page...

     "The council has decided to end trade with Novindus.
      I understand that this will bring dire consequences
      upon us. Still, we have betrayed our lands unknowingly,
      we have betrayed ourselves and our prosperity, as have we
      been betrayed by the Emerald Queen. I know that soon 
        death comes upon us. Still, I am comforted knowing that
      the world will not suffer for our stupidity any longer.
      May we have the strength to endure what we have brought
      upon ourselves....

rooms.Name: The Street Leading to the Kingdom Garrison
rooms.Description:
This path has been well travelled. The Kingdom soldiers march through here
every day to perform thier duties. The garrison being so close to the
Vale of Dreams, a disupted border between the Kingdom and Kesh, it sees
it's share of action. It has been peaceful here, despite the plague,
due to the negotiations between the Kingdom and Kesh.

rooms.Name: A Common Villager's Home
rooms.Description:
You see the usual, a small hearth, a table, wooden bowls. You see a bag full
of smelly herbs. In the corner are two beds, small, yet comfortable. These
people weren't rich, but they were content.

rooms.Name: On the Road through Shamata
rooms.Description:
You have decided you really shouldn't be here. Plagues aren't your idea
of a good time. Not to mention, these people aren't really in a "party"
mood, what with dying and all...You notice a burned building to the
west. It is still smoldering. It had to have been burned recently. You
wonder about the fate of those who dwelt inside.

rooms.Name: A Common Villager's Home
rooms.Description:
You see the usual, a small hearth, a table, wooden bowls. You see a bag full
of smelly herbs. In the corner are two beds, small, yet comfortable. These
people weren't rich, but they were content.

rooms.Name: A Common Villager's Home
rooms.Description:
You see the usual, a small hearth, a table, wooden bowls. You see a bag full
of smelly herbs. In the corner are two beds, small, yet comfortable. These
people weren't rich, but they were content.

rooms.Name: On the Road through Shamata
rooms.Description:
You stand in the street of Shamata. To the east is a home, it looks deserted
for quite some time now. You smell the stench of death eminating from that
direction. There is a small shop to the west. A sign hangs above the door
and a note is posted upon it. It is a small one room building in which
a healer resides. You wonder what went so wrong that he couldn't save these
suffering people.

ExtraDescs.Description:
My people of Shamata, I regret to inform you that I can aid you no longer.
I, too have contracted the disease of this cursed town. I am too weak
too afford such activities. Our olny hope is that Lims-Kragma will have
mercy upon our souls and that our children will be able to free them-
selves from this curse. I now bis you farewell, for I fear these are
the last words I will speak in this life.

                                              Farewell Good People,
                                              Taelok Jaalon

rooms.Name: Ravensburg's Main Street
rooms.Description:
A charming little town, this Ravensburg. Calm, uiet, peaceful. You feel
that something important began here, although you have no clue as to what
it was. The buildings are small, yet livable. The shops are kept nicely.
The people are friendly enough. You may grow to like this town.
There is a small sign here.

rooms.Name: The Town Forge
rooms.Description:
As you enter this building, you notice that it looks somewhat like a barn.
Hay covers the dust that makes up the floor. There are square posts supporting
a high thatched roof. Articles of leather hang upon the posts. There is a 
large metal forge to the right made from stone and covered with plaster.
It burns inside with and intensity that you would find only in a dragon's
breath. A large wooden table stands here with various tools lain upon it.
Barding for horses and farm tools lie around insistently waiting to be
repaired. Eric, the smith apprentice, doesn't seem to be anywhere around.

rooms.Name: The Pintail Inn
rooms.Description:
This is the Pintail Inn. Eric grew up here, living with his mother and
the Innkeeper, who was the closest thing he had to a father while growing
up. There is a large hearth and fireplace against the wall, with a huge
kettle of stew simmering fragrantly. Bread dough has been placed in
sealable cast iron containers and put under the hot coals to bake.
Visitors are sitting about the six tables here, enjoying a meal,
drinking, and talking amongst themselves.

rooms.Name: Ravensburg's Main Street
rooms.Description:
A charming little town, this Ravensburg. Calm, quiet, peaceful. You feel
that something important began here, although you have no clue as to what
it was. The buildings are small, yet livable. The shops are kept nicely.
The people seem friendly enough. You may grow to like this town.

rooms.Name: A Commoner's Home
rooms.Description:
This is a usual home of a Krondorian. Just a small one room building, with the 
necessary furnishings and a large hearth. You aren't sure how long you should
stay, for this isn't your home, and you weren't invited inside.

rooms.Name: A Commoner's Home
rooms.Description:
This is a usual home of a Krondorian. Just a small one room building, with the 
necessary furnishings and a large hearth. You aren't sure how long you should
stay, for this isn't your home, and you weren't invited inside.

rooms.Name: A Commoner's Home
rooms.Description:
This is a usual home of a Krondorian. Just a small one room building, with the 
necessary furnishings and a large hearth. You aren't sure how long you should
stay, for this isn't your home, and you weren't invited inside.

rooms.Name: A Street in Ravensburg
rooms.Description:
You are in Ravensburg, a nice, quiant little town with some nice people
and dark secrets. This street leads through the southern portion of
the town, mostly a residential area. The houses are small, but seem
to utilize the space well, and the gardens outside of town give the 
citizen ample room to cultivate the land.

rooms.Name: A Street in Ravensburg
rooms.Description:
You are in Ravensburg, a nice, quiant little town with some nice people
and dark secrets. This street leads through the southern portion of
the town, mostly a residential area. The houses are small, but seem
to utilize the space well, and the gardens outside of town give the 
citizen ample room to cultivate the land.

rooms.Name: A Street in Ravensburg
rooms.Description:
You are in Ravensburg, a nice, quiant little town with some nice people
and dark secrets. This street leads through the southern portion of
the town, mostly a residential area. The houses are small, but seem
to utilize the space well, and the gardens outside of town give the 
citizen ample room to cultivate the land.

rooms.Name: The Crossroads
rooms.Description:
You have stepped into the middle of the crossroads that connect Darkmoor
with other baronies near it. From here a road leads in each direction,
taking you wherever you want to go, and to all the adventure you can
handle.

rooms.Name: A Street in Ravensburg
rooms.Description:
You are in Ravensburg, a nice, quiant little town with some nice people
and dark secrets. This street leads through the southern portion of
the town, mostly a residential area. The houses are small, but seem
to utilize the space well, and the gardens outside of town give the 
citizen ample room to cultivate the land.

rooms.Name: A Street in Ravensburg
rooms.Description:
You are in Ravensburg, a nice, quiant little town with some nice people
and dark secrets. This street leads through the southern portion of
the town, mostly a residential area. The houses are small, but seem
to utilize the space well, and the gardens outside of town give the 
citizen ample room to cultivate the land.

rooms.Name: A Street in Ravensburg
rooms.Description:
You are in Ravensburg, a nice, quiant little town with some nice people
and dark secrets. This street leads through the southern portion of
the town, mostly a residential area. The houses are small, but seem
to utilize the space well, and the gardens outside of town give the 
citizen ample room to cultivate the land.

rooms.Name: Roo's Room
rooms.Description:
This used to be Rupert's room. Everyone called him Roo for short. His
father was wealthy by Ravensburg standards, a merchant by trade. Roo
was a small boy, and they became extremely close after Eric began
taking up for the boy, as Eric was a very muscular youth. Roo was
known as quite a thief by his freinds, and this room is full of
"aquired" trinkets.

rooms.Name: Rupert Avery's Home
rooms.Description:
Rupert Avery lived here with his parents before he and his best friend
Eric got into trouble for killing Stephan, the Baron's son and Eric's
half brother. The two had been friends ever since they could remember.
Now they are both gone, and noone knows what was done with them.

rooms.Name: The General Store
rooms.Description:
This is where you can buy odds and ends of all kinds. Travellers need
all manners of item while travelling. You can buy food to carry with
you or some of the town's excellent wine. You look about, wondering if
there is anything you would like...

rooms.Name: Ravensburg's Main Street
rooms.Description:
As you continue walking, you notice a large building to the west. It is made
of brick and is surrounded by a four foot iron fence. It has large windows
on the front and seems to be very important. The grocer is to the east
where you will find interesting products of this Barony, and some excellent
wine.

rooms.Name: The Parlor
rooms.Description:
This is where Otto's and Mathilda's courthship took place. Although they
had been betrothed at a late age, courtship was still a custom. It was
a weary task for Otto, for he never loved his wife. His true love for
Freida, Eric's mother, was never publicly proclaimed, for fear of
disgrace to the upcoming Baroness.

rooms.Name: The Bottom of a Flight of Stairs
rooms.Description:
You stand before a flight of stairs leading upward. It is made of walnut
deeply stained and crafted by a skilled hand. The stairs spiral up to
the second floor.

rooms.Name: The Pantry
rooms.Description:
You look about this small, dimly lit room and see that food is stacked
upon shelves that line all four walls. Maybe you could find a snack to take
along with you on your journey.

rooms.Name: The Kitchen
rooms.Description:
Of course, this is the place where the Baron's family is prepared their
meals. But is also more, for the gossip of the town that passes here is
rivaled only by the youthful gossip at the town fountain.

rooms.Name: The Dining Hall
rooms.Description:
In this room there is a candle chandalier hanging above a heavy, finely
crafted dinner table. This is where the noble family recieves it's meals
each night. Many a long stare has been passed about this table by it's
owners.

rooms.Name: The Baron of Darkmoor's Home
rooms.Description:
You have entered the home of the Otto von Darkmoor. You stand in the
entryway of this comparativly large home. This is where he resides along with
his two legitimate sons, Stephan and Manfred, and his wife, the Baroness
Mathilda. Despite the repeated attempts by Eric's mother by questioning
Otto publicly to claim Eric, he never did. But he never denied it, and
that has always been a thorn in the Baroness's side.

Exits.Description: A set of large wooden double doors stand in your way.

rooms.Name: Standing Before the Home of the Baron
rooms.Description:
Before you stands the home of the Baron of Darkmoor, Otto von Darkmoor.
He and his wife, along with their two sons reside in this large home.
The Baron's carriage awaits the command from the Baron to depart,
while a team of draft horses is being hitched to it. The home is two
stories tall, a rarity in the small town, and is made of red brick.

Exits.Description: A pair of large wooden double doors stand in your way.

rooms.Name: Darkmoor Guard's Headquarters
rooms.Description:
This is the headquarters of the Baron's guard. All dispatches are routed
through this small building. All guards report here each day for assignments.
Runners hustle and scamper around seeing that the Baron's orders are issued
with precision and speed.

rooms.Name: The Guard's Bar
rooms.Description:
This is where seasoned soldiers tell of their great conquests and victories
over impossible foes. The soldiers coming in from a hard day's duty are
sitting around tables having a tankard of ale, unwinding from the rigors
of military life. This is not a good place to start a fight.

rooms.Name: The Practice Yard
rooms.Description:
This is where inexperience soldiers get their first taste of battle, and
experienced soldiers hone their skills with their comrades. Mock battles
take form here each and every morning and afternoon. Blood does sometimes
get spilled upon occasion, but is rarely intentional.

rooms.Name: The Inn's Stables
rooms.Description:
This is where the horses and mules are kept for the guests of the Inn.
Animals are lashed in stalls all around you. The smith's apprentice, Eric
von Darkmoor is said to be the best caretaker of horses ever known. At
the age of 15, it was said he could make a lame mule work again. But the
bastard son of the Baron is nowhere to be found.

rooms.Name: The Loft of the Forge
rooms.Description:
As far back as he could remember, this had been Eric's room. You see
a bed fashioned from hay covered by a large dining cloth. Eric used
to lie here and dream of having his own forge one day, and being
the master smith of Ravensburg, although his mother had her own ideas
for his future. She would try to have the Baron recognize him as heir
to Darkmoor until the day the Baron died. But the name von Darkmoor
was never denied him by his father.

rooms.Name: The Winery's Grape Storage
rooms.Description:
The aroma in this room is incredible. Beautiful odors of the grapes for
Darkmoor wine float about the room. The scent, you can see, comes from the
great sealed crates lined upon the walls and stacked all over this large
room. They are filled on wagons in the grape fields and carted here to
await their transformation.

rooms.Name: The Winery Vats
rooms.Description:
This is where the delicacy is transformed from crude fruit to a delicate,
delicious drink. The vats are made of plates of wrought iron, and stand
twelve feet tall. They are eight feet in diameter. There are seven
vats standing in this room.

rooms.Name: The Wine Storehouse
rooms.Description:
This is where the wine is aged. Great casks of mohogany are rotated in
and out according to their age. A metal pipe runs from the vats to a pump
here in this room, from which the casks are filled. The casks are set
into shelves cut to a round shape, to keep the barrels from shifting.
There are twelve such shelves, each full of sweet wine

rooms.Name: The Office of the Ravensburg Winery
rooms.Description:
This is where all of the wine is produced in Ravensburg. Darkmoor is
famous for all of it's sweet wines. This is the office that governs
the making of such a great pleasure. Maps of destinations for the red
liquid are posted upon the walls, and orders are being processed by
the few who can read.

rooms.Name: At the End of the Street
rooms.Description:
You have come to a dead end. You look around and see a huge building in
front of you. It is the largest building in Ravensburg. It is the
great winery. The economic backbone of this small town.

rooms.Name: The Winery's Sales and Shipping
rooms.Description:
This is where merchants from all around come to buy the wine of Darkmoor.
Casks are put on carts from the storehouse and wheeled out to the
merchant's awaiting carriage. The amount of wine that has left these
is unimaginable, for wine has been made here as long as the bards have
sung it's history.

rooms.Name: A Commoner's Home
rooms.Description:
This is a usual home of a Krondorian. Just a small one room building, with the 
necessary furnishings and a large hearth. You aren't sure how long you should
stay, for this isn't your home, and you weren't invited inside.

rooms.Name: A Commoner's Home
rooms.Description:
This is a usual home of a Krondorian. Just a small one room building, with the 
necessary furnishings and a large hearth. You aren't sure how long you should
stay, for this isn't your home, and you weren't invited inside.

rooms.Name: A Commoner's Home
rooms.Description:
This is a usual home of a Krondorian. Just a small one room building, with the 
necessary furnishings and a large hearth. You aren't sure how long you should
stay, for this isn't your home, and you weren't invited inside.

rooms.Name: Ravensburg's Main Street
rooms.Description:
A charming little town, this Ravensburg. Calm, quiet, peaceful. You feel
that something important began here, although you have no clue as to what
it was. The buildings are small, yet livable. The shops are kept nicely.
The people seem friendly enough. You may grow to like this town.

rooms.Name: A Stockyard
rooms.Description:
This is where the citizens of Ravensburg buy and sell animals and beasts
of burden. Pigs, goats, oxen, chickens, and horses are all separated in
their pens, only a feather away from each other. Here you can buy a
hard working animal or a life-long friend, and you had better hurry,
because it stinks like something died here.

rooms.Name: A Street in Ravensburg
rooms.Description:
You are in Ravensburg, a nice, quiant little town with some nice people
and dark secrets. This street leads through the southern portion of
the town, mostly a residential area. The houses are small, but seem
to utilize the space well, and the gardens outside of town give the 
citizen ample room to cultivate the land.

rooms.Name: A Street in Ravensburg
rooms.Description:
You are in Ravensburg, a nice, quiant little town with some nice people
and dark secrets. This street leads through the southern portion of
the town, mostly a residential area. The houses are small, but seem
to utilize the space well, and the gardens outside of town give the 
citizen ample room to cultivate the land.

rooms.Name: A Street in Ravensburg
rooms.Description:
You are in Ravensburg, a nice, quiant little town with some nice people
and dark secrets. This street leads through the southern portion of
the town, mostly a residential area. The houses are small, but seem
to utilize the space well, and the gardens outside of town give the 
citizen ample room to cultivate the land.

rooms.Name: The Fountain
rooms.Description:
This is the fountain at the crossroads. Here the younger generation come and
gather socially. Most of the townsfolk found their mates at this very spot.
The young men of this town gather here to court the young women that come
to hear the latest gossip. Surely the young ladies have other things on their
minds as well. The fountain is large, about twelve feet in diameter, with
the fountain walls themselves carved into benches upon which no less
than seven quite pretty young ladies rest.

rooms.Name: A Street in Ravensburg
rooms.Description:
You are in Ravensburg, a nice, quiant little town with some nice people
and dark secrets. This street leads through the southern portion of
the town, mostly a residential area. The houses are small, but seem
to utilize the space well, and the gardens outside of town give the 
citizen ample room to cultivate the land.

rooms.Name: A Street in Ravensburg
rooms.Description:
You are in Ravensburg, a nice, quiant little town with some nice people
and dark secrets. This street leads through the southern portion of
the town, mostly a residential area. The houses are small, but seem
to utilize the space well, and the gardens outside of town give the 
citizen ample room to cultivate the land.

rooms.Name: The Home of an Old Man
rooms.Description:
You enter the room and wait for your eyes to adjust to the dim light
in the room. You hear a voice say softly "Close that door, youth, the
light hurts my old eyes. Come, sit and talk with me, for there is much
to tell." You begin to see the outline of an old man sitting on a 
chair by a fire almost burned out.

rooms.Name: Father Dugan's Study
rooms.Description:
This is where the leader of the faithful studies and practices his art.
It is scattered with scrolls and books, for the Father isn't a tidy
man. It is small and lit only by two candles, both on the table which
contains his recorded work.

rooms.Name: A Beautifully Fashioned Church
rooms.Description:
This is where the people of Ravensburg come to express thier devotions
to thier gods. Many come to pray to Ruthia, goddess of luck, to bring
happiness in some form or another. Many gods have visited these temples,
shrines of thier existence. Long has it been known that to kill or
enter into a sacred place with evil intention brings instant death to
those who dare oppose the unwritten law. The Midkemian gods do not
take kindly to insubordination, or the desecration of thier subject's
place of worship. Be wary here, and pure of heart, or fate will suffer
you no longer. A feeling of peace permeates the very structure here.

rooms.Name: Ravensburg's Main Street
rooms.Description:
A charming little town, this Ravensburg. Calm, quiet, peaceful. You feel
that something important began here, although you have no clue as to what
it was. The buildings are small, yet livable. The shops are kept nicely.
The people seem friendly enough. You may grow to like this town.

rooms.Name: The Music Room
rooms.Description:
This is the room where the Baron will sit for hours on end as he is
seranaded by musicians. His love of music was only matched by his agony
over ghis true firstborn son. Music one the one respite from the storm
of agony visited upon his from day to day. There sits a lyre and a 
harpischord in this room, along with violas hung upon the wall.

rooms.Name: The Bottom of a Flight of Stairs
rooms.Description:
You stand before a flight of stairs leading upward. It is made of walnut
deeply stained and crafted by a skilled hand. The stairs spiral up to
the second floor.

rooms.Name: Servant's Area
rooms.Description:
This is the gathering place for the servants of the Baron's home.
Servitude in a noble's hame has never been a disgrace. It is a calling
often specifically from the noble himself. Servants await their master's
bidding here.

rooms.Name: A Small Yard
rooms.Description:
You step out of the stalls to find that the stench of animals doesn't
dominate your nostrils any longer. This yard is small, about 10 cubits
square, past which vegetation grows rampantly, overtaking the surrounding
land. There are clothes lines here, with tunics of visitors strung
haphazardly on the lines to dry in the spring air. To the west you notice
a small shed.

rooms.Name: A Small Shed
rooms.Description:
This has always been the quarters for the blacksmith. It is small, yet
comfortable, but more importantly, close to the forge. Tyndal used to sit
in this room and get extremely drunk. The rank odor of vomit used to
pervade this building, until Tyndal died. Now a new master smith has
taken his place. This is now Nathan's room.

rooms.Name: The Hall to the Rooms
rooms.Description:
This hall is small, only three feet wide, and quite dim. It is, however,
clean and tidy. Eric's mother has always kept the Inn in perfect operation
for years, and the state of the Inn is her upmost concern next to her
son.

rooms.Name: The Hall to the Rooms
rooms.Description:
This hall is small, only three feet wide, and quite dim. It is, however,
clean and tidy. Eric's mother has always kept the Inn in perfect operation
for years, and the state of the Inn is her upmost concern next to her
son.

rooms.Name: The End of the Hall
rooms.Description:
This hall is small, only three feet wide, and quite dim. It is, however,
clean and tidy. Eric's mother has always kept the Inn in perfect operation
for years, and the state of the Inn is her upmost concern next to her
son.

rooms.Name: A Room in the Pintail Inn
rooms.Description:
This is just a regular sleeping quarter for the guests of the Inn.
It is a small room with a straw stuffed mat, a small table with a lamp,
and a large chest for the guests to keep their personal belongings in.
Noone know how many visitors this room has been throughout the years.

Exits.Description: Under a plank a passage leads down

rooms.Name: A Room in the Pintail Inn
rooms.Description:
This is just a regular sleeping quarter for the guests of the Inn.
It is a small room with a straw stuffed mat, a small table with a lamp,
and a large chest for the guests to keep their personal belongings in.
Noone know how many visitors this room has been throughout the years.

rooms.Name: A Room in the Pintail Inn
rooms.Description:
This is just a regular sleeping quarter for the guests of the Inn.
It is a small room with a straw stuffed mat, a small table with a lamp,
and a large chest for the guests to keep their personal belongings in.
Noone know how many visitors this room has been throughout the years.

rooms.Name: Upon a Balcony
rooms.Description:
You stand upon a balcony on the second floor of the Baron's home. To the
east, across the main street, you see the guard station. To the north
you see the Grower's and Vintor's Guild, where the wine of the barony
is made. A cool breeze is blowing from the west.

rooms.Name: The Top of the Stair
rooms.Description:
You have made it upstairs to the slepeing quarters of the nobility of Darkmoor.
You have to wonder how many happy moments have passes here, for they couldn't
number many.

rooms.Name: Otto's and Mathilda's Bedroom
rooms.Description:
This is where the Baron has spent many lonely nights with a woman he
has become accustomed to. Noone knows if there has ever been any 
feelings between the two, and noone may ever find out, for Otto is
here dying.

rooms.Name: Manfred's Bedroom
rooms.Description:
This is Manfred's bedroom, the younger noble son of Otto. Manfred is
more well tempered than his older brother, Stephan. He sees Eric as
more of an enigma than any threat. What he doesn't know is that Eric
will cause HIM to become Baron von Darkmoor.

rooms.Name: The Common Hall
rooms.Description:
This is a circular room with three bedroom adjoining around the west side.
There is a small chandalier hanging here, providing little light, save
the windows.

Exits.Description: A door with a carving of a falcon.
A door with a carving of a lion.
A door with the engraving of a raven.

rooms.Name: Upon a Balcony
rooms.Description:
You stand upon a balcony on the second floor of the Baron's home. To the
east, across the main street, you see the guard station. To the north
you see the Grower's and Vintor's Guild, where the wine of the barony
is made. A cool breeze is blowing from the west.

rooms.Name: Upon a Balcony
rooms.Description:
You stand upon a balcony on the second floor of the Baron's home. To the
east, across the main street, you see the guard station. To the north
you see the Grower's and Vintor's Guild, where the wine of the barony
is made. A cool breeze is blowing from the west.

rooms.Name: The Top of the Stair
rooms.Description:
You have made it upstairs to the slepeing quarters of the nobility of Darkmoor.
You have to wonder how many happy moments have passes here, for they couldn't
number many.

rooms.Name: Stephan's Bedroom
rooms.Description:
Stephan is the older of the two noble sons. He is the heir-apparent of
this barony. Stephan holds Eric in the greatest of contempt, for he sees
him as a threat to his rise to power.
